result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda J Swartz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Subject to Good Time & Work Release.

Must report to Probation by 4:30 p.m. on 9/21/2016.
Must follow rules of Probation.

miscConds.notes: $200.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to Probation while on Probation.

Must provide DNA sample.
Must take medications as prescribed & follow physician's orders as to prescribed medication.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Amanda J Swartz in court with attorney Brian Thomas Smestad.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 11:41 am.  
AMENDED COMPLAINT TO BE FILED BY 9/30.
Count 1-Dom/repeater STRICKEN - Def-NC plea.  CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered.
CT-Count 2 dismissed.  
SENTENCE:  I&S 30 days, subj to GT & WR.  Probation up to 1 yr, follow rules of probation, take medications & follow doctors orders as to medications.  Fine/costs waived.  Must provide DNA sample, $200 surcharge payable thru probation.  Must report to probation by 4:30 on 9/21.  PCR. 11:56 am adj.
